title: Cup And Saucer, "Classical Scenes", 1922
markings: Marks: On underside of cup: Imperial Porcelain Factory mark for Alexander III with 90, stamped in green underglaze; hammer, sickle, cog, 1922 N 283/6 hand-painted in blue overglaze. On underside of saucer: Imperial PorcelainFactory mark for Nicholas II with 1914 stamped in green underglaze; hammer, sickle, cog, 1922, N283/6 hand-painted in blue overglaze
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Cup cylindrical with flaring lip, scroll handle with palmette motif at base; painted around sides in grisaille with scenes of classical architecture and garden ruins; green oakleaf border at top. Saucer circular with raised edge; painted in the center with scene of classical temple ruins, trees, figures, with a green oakleaf border
